div.h4: Healthy Hydration at LHS Posted Date: 04/06/2020
div.p: Lavaca High School recently received a grant from the Blue & You Foundation to install a bottle filling station in the high school gymnasium. This new filling station will not only benefit students . . .

div.style: background:url(//s3.amazonaws.com/scschoolfiles/1853/img_lnk__vln5s6.png);background-position: center center; background-repeat: no-repeat;

div.p:
ACT has decided to reschedule the April 4, 2020 National ACT® test date to our June 13 and July 18 test dates in response to concerns regarding the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19).
ACT will . . .

div.style: background:url(//s3.amazonaws.com/scschoolfiles/1853/img_pd_144719_a176c1.jpg);background-position: center center; background-repeat: no-repeat;

div.h4: Lavaca Gifted and Talented Coordinator Selected as Faculty for the 2020 Arkansas Governor’s School Posted Date: 03/06/2020

div.p: Lavaca Public Schools is hiring bus drivers for bus routes. A class B CDL is required with both P and S Endorsement. Full time bus drivers qualify for insurance. Please contact 479-674-5611 for more information.

center.h4: TEA program (services for teen parents and low-income families)

div.p: The TEA program provides services for teen parents and low-income families. Our objective with teen parents is to provide the necessary services to assure they remain in school and graduate. We also provide services for low income families to assist them in returning to the workforce through educational and training opportunities.

center.h4: AAA Dead Period Extended through May 30

div.p: AAA will extend the Dead Period for all AAA member schools through May 30, 2020

Per the Governor of Arkansas and Department of Health, on-site instruction for all public schools has been suspended for the remainder of the 19-20 school year. AMI assignments will continue through the remainder of the year.

hr.p: Steve Rose (Lavaca Schools Superintendent), Kenny Holland (Lavaca Middle School Principal), Krysta Winchester (Lavaca Middle School Teacher), and Brooka Meredith (Lavaca Middle School Teacher), pictured here with Arkansas Department of Education representative Otistene Smith, were in Kansas City, MO on January 31,2019 to accept an award for closing the achievement gap between student populations.

span.span: Lavaca Public School District held a Ribbon Cutting Ceremony to celebrate the construction of the Lavaca Elementary School Safe Room November 6, 2017. The Safe Room is located just behind the Elementary School.
